Feb.'10-Aug.'11 Cem Bialetti ( Subsidiary of Bialetti Industrie SPA/Italy ) Istanbul CFO - Financial Affairs and Supply Chain Management Initiator/essential part of turnaround/change management within the Company via overseeing many value added projects within the framework of Finance and Supply Chain Management. Handled corporate renewal and get it out from insolvent position. Long-term strategic and recovery restructuring plans were created, implemented, permanently reviewed their progress and made alterations to the plan as needed to ensure the Company returns to solvency. Natural member of Executive Steering Committee which was held twice a month. Managed sixteen ( 16 ) people including Finance, Accounting, Financial Controlling, Procurement, Foreign Trade. Besides, dealing with legal issues via lawyers and introduced continuous relationship with outsourced companies . Succeeded submitting Group Reporting Bundles based on IFRS time interval from 15th working day to 5th working day and statutory closing from 12th working day to 3rd working day within four ( 4 ) months. Overcome reducing Cash Conversion Cycle ( CCC ) of the Company from 220 days to 180 days in six ( 6 ) months and created a direct and positive impact on Working Capital. Published a Monthly Reporting Calendar which includes Purchase Price Variance ( PPV ) compared to budget; Manufacturing Overhead ( MoH ) , Days Sales Outstanding ( DSO ) , Days Payment Outstanding ( DPO ) , Days Inventory Outstanding ( DIO ) , Gross Profit Margin Analysis per Channels, per Product Lines, Variable and Fixed Costs Analysis, IBP/S and OP, Monthly Phasing AOP, NPD costing, Top and Bottom Line P/L Management, OWC, OFCF, B/S items' control especially Inventory and Credit Control Management in order to drive out obsolete and slow moving stocks and bad debt exposures, NDA and Charge-back rules with suppliers, Squeeze and X-trim projects to reduce Cost of Goods Manufactured ( CoGM ) . Created upside effects via pushing Sales Team to collect overdue dated receivables and diminished Doubtful Rec. exposure from 3 mio TL to 1 mio TL and written-off remaining balance after being sure that these are 100% uncollectible and solved this crucial concern arising from previous periods. Constituted a round table approach to determine finished goods' selling prices in the course of tender periods. CoGM computations were corrected in a compromising and convincing way by justified reasons during Executive Steering Committees due to former miscalculations, which ended up in getting tenders based on wrong cost calculations and making dramatical losses. Worked with Earning while buying principle and made countless savings for the Company. Reduced Company's Financial Expenses by 66% via negotiating with banks and provided direct positive effect to the bottom line. Changed Fleet Car Rental Company and saved 20% and removed km. limit. Renewed Company's Operating Elementary Insurance Policy by reducing the annual fee 50% via covering simultaneously Business Interruption Risk. Increased the level of Departmental staff by hiring best and brightest candidates. Kicked-off MRP II in Mikro ( current ERP software ) and planned smooth implementation stage and aligned with Parent Company to pass through SAP at the beginning of 2012.
Oct.'06-Jan.'10 Soyak Cement Istanbul CFO - Deputy General Manager Conducting all the financial and administrative affairs of the 175 million-USD 'Integrated Cement Facility' and 13 million-USD 'Port' investments, effectuating the framed organizational and operational business A professional side participant to the monthly stated Board of Directors ( B.o.D ) meetings and informing B.o.D about the financial position of the firm Setting up Accounting, Finance, Budget and Financial Controlling departments of a 15-employee team for the production period ( currently handling 9 employees ) , determining their job descriptions and managing Playing an active role in selection of SAP as the Entreprise Resource Planning ( ERP ) and taking place in the 'Steering Committee' about Financial Modules ( Phase 1/FI, CO-CCA, TR, AA, FI-MM and CO-MM integration ) and enabling the smooth transition to live implemantation within the shortest possible time of three ( 3 ) months Handling the feasability reports on the Cement Facility and the Port, acquiring the optimum-interest rates for the 130-million USD credit on 'cement' and 10-million USD credit on 'port' from Garanti Bank Project Finance Department Signing an agreement with Garanti Bank on 'Banking and Insurance Transactions Protocol' so as to minimize the banking costs of the firm Using gradually non-cash ( Letter of Credit ) and cash ( suppliers' and sub-contractors' expenditures ) credit tranches of the released foreign-origin credit ( Garanti Bank-Luxembourg branch ) within the framework of quarterly revised 'Cash Flow Budget' and preparing the Credit Repayment Schedules in conformity with this procedure Besides 'Cash Flow Budget', shedding light on the financial upcoming of the firm by preparing the five ( 5 ) -yrs. Financial Statements Budgets during the post-investment and post-commissioning periods. Enabling the Full Certification Tax Audit scope of the firm as to make an effective Tax Planning; despite there is no taxable basement, getting the audits completed before the Pre-paid Corporate Tax periods, acquiring written consent on tax-risky or tax-ruling points for the writings to the Fiscal Administration. Drawing a finacial advantage for the firm in the non-sale cash inflow/investment period by evaluating the remaining from the Luxembourg-origin withdrawn credit tranches at Garanti Bank Malta Branch through benefiting from high real interest rates on local currency ( TL ) and avoiding 15 % witholding tax Upon the compulsory payments to the suppliers/sub-contarctors from called Garanti Luxembourg branch cash credit tranche, the remaining TL is re-sold with the same Foreign Exchange ( F/X ) rate back to Luxembourg, thus avoiding 0.1% Foreign Exchange Excise Tax and waiting for the optimum F/X rates to convert into TL in order to benefit from the high real interest rates on TL in Malta. During the project period, applying 'Cost Control' method comparing and contrasting both Monthly 'Financial Statements' and 'Cash Flows' on the basis of actual versus budgeted/forecasted statements ; briefing the reasons for positive/negative deviations; reporting them to G.M and BoD ; offering preventive actions on high positive deviations in the following months Acquiring Investment Incentives Certificate ; with respect, importing machinery and equipment within the context of Letter of Credit without customs and Value Added Tax ( VAT ) ; obtaining positive finance resources with VAT exemption in domestic steel production and related labor cost while investment stage Being last approval mechanism with G.M. about sub-contractors' monthly progress payments and purchase demands of over 10 thousand TL
Assuring the coordination between the Facility-Headquarters relationship ; constant and steady information flow between technical and administrative departments; organizing and moderating inter-departments meetings in budget/forecast periods especially with construction/steel/electricity-energy and mechanics departments which are the driving force of the investment to reach consistent and solid budgeted/forecasted figures
May.'04-Oct.'06 Abdi İbrahim Pharmaceuticals Incorp. Istanbul International Markets Finance and Accounting Manager Tied-up functionnaly to Finance Director and dotted line basis to International Markets Director. Was in charge of Algeria, Holland, Poland Limited Companies and CIS countries such as Russia, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Georgia and Azerbaijan Representative Offices' financial issues. Established financial modelling, system set-up via templates, report writing and presentations to Top Management. Ensured a proper running reporting system flow from Limited Companies and Rep. Offices towards Parent Company in hands on basis with respect to budget, rolling forecasts and cash-flow basis. Set up budget discipline in International Markets. Gathered regularly and punctually cash advances requests from Rep. Offices within the budgeted cash flow design installed to cover their operating expenses to be booked at month ends into the Parent Company's Financials. Intervened cash advances requests' deviations when required and assured the compliance within forecasted figures. Took proactive measures and avoided excess unnecessary monetary stocks and founded just-in-time method. Prepared respectively and consolidated monthly budgets and rolling forecasts both in Financial Statements and cash-flow basis, compared them with actual realizations. Installed a tight follow-up of Parent Company's receivables/collections system and diminished the Days Sales Outstanding figures. On the other hand, provided to increase Average Payment Period against suppliers by making proper agreements. This turn around action enabled countries to have a better cash-flow management. Handled the inventory leverage to avoid destruction of drugs due to close expiry dates. Determined the medicine prices by comparing the manufacturing costs incurred for International Markets depending on countries' market conditions. Performed estimated three years profitability analysis of products and decided whether penetrating is feasible or not. Prepared whole managerial and applicational process required for government grant purposes provided by the State. Controlled, intervened and provided the necessary actions while the preparation of Y/E Financial Statements of Limited Companies situated abroad. Dealt with the transference of Algeria and Poland shares into Abdi İbrahim Int. B.V./Holland. Interfered immediately, managed and solved punctually all financial concerns occurred both in Limited Companies and Rep. Offices. Visited countries frequently and avoided only managing from Headquarters. This strategy furnished to know intensively what should be done in priority and enabled to take precautions before the threat is occurred. Worked closely with peers either in Finance and International Markets Departments. Established good and communicative day to day relationship both with countries' and in-house's colleagues. Sept.'00-Apr.'04 Bosch and Siemens Home Appliances Group Istanbul Field Manager - Central Controlling, Group Reporting and Accounting Prepared Financial Statements in conformity with International Financial Reporting Standards ( 'IFRS', formerly denominated as I.A.S. ) in hard currency basis ( functional currency was Euro ) . Performed five years budgets and forecasts within the current year ( number of forecasts were dependent on economical conditions of Turkey ) with regard to Management Reporting ( HB ) , German Commercial Code - local GAAP ( HB I ) and German GAAP HGB - HB II ( including respective adjustments in accordance with BSH Germany Guidelines ) both in TL and Euro basis. Prepared detailed quarterly actual reportings both to top management and BSH Germany in 'German GAAP-HB II' basis. Performed inflation and hard currency assumptions on monthly basis for budgets and forecasts. Worked with independent auditors within the preparation process of Capital Market Board ( C.M.B. ) reporting issued every six months; provided proper information, controlled the reports and discussed the outcome. Assured co-ordination, gathered information from consolidated BSH Group Companies on monthly and yearly basis, provided supervision and ensured that rendered financial results reflect the fair position of Group Companies, supported and controlled their financial matters. Managed the coordination of financial issues between Bosch and Siemens Home Appliances Group ( Parent Company ) and BSHPEG-Group Turkey, prepared direct reporting to B.o.D. Performed Financial Analysis in comparative basis between budgeted, forecasted and actual balances. Took responsibilities during the merger stage between BSH PEG production Company and sales and marketing legal entities held on the 1st of October, 2001 and supported this process as a smooth transition for the Group. Responsible for performing Risk Management Reporting Performed the Economic Value Added ( E.V.A. ) reporting which measures the success of the management on quarterly actual, budgeted and forecasted basis. Sept.'96-Aug.'00 PricewaterhouseCoopers Istanbul Experienced Audit Senior Participated in various audit services rendered especially to production and service companies. Major clients were; Cineplex Odeon - Kültür ve Gözteri Merkezleri İşletmecilik A.Ş. ( KGM ) , Pars Mc Cann - Erickson Reklamcılık A.Ş., Grafika Lintas Reklamcılık A.Ş., DYG İlan ve Reklam Hizmetleri A.Ş., Hürriyet Gazetecilik ve Matbaacılık A.Ş., Goodyear, Michelin, Eczacıbaşı İlaç Sanayii, Eczacıbaşı-Baxter, Synthélabo İlaç Tic. A.Ş., SIF Otomotiv, Yüce Oto, Eczacıbaşı Askaynak-Lincoln Electric Inc., British American Tobacco ( BAT ) , Mannesmann-Rexroth Hidropar A.Ş., Bureau Véritas Gözetim Hizmetleri Ltd. Şti., Çelebi Hava Servisi A.Ş., Planet Yapı Malzemeleri A.Ş., Kuveyt Türk Evkaf Finans Kurumu A.Ş. and Güneş Sigorta. Prepared financial statements in accordance with the International Accounting Standards ( IAS ) , United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( US GAAP ) and Turkish Capital Market Board Standards. Applied IAS 29 ( Financial reporting in hyperinflationary economies ) during the audit services which were rendered according to IAS. Reported in hard currencies ( USD, DM and FRF ) by applying IAS and US GAAP. Participated in audit service given to Türk Telekom, which was a step for the privatisation process of the company. Managed audit teams, and coordinated the relations between team members, team manager, engagement leader and clients.
June.'95-Aug.'95 ( 85 days ) Renault S.A. Paris Commercial Agent ( summer intern through AIESEC ) Interfaced between the Renault distributors in Middle East and Northern Africa ( MENA ) countries and the factories in France. Managed vehicle orders, shipments and financing.

Resulted in a saving of 15% in discounts ( from 31% to 26% ) worth TL 6.0M in one year. Through monitoring and optimizing the dealers' stocks, lowered stock outs and increased sales volume by 6%, NR increased by 24%. Major achievements through years 2009 - 2011 respectively are, NR TL 237k, 258k ( 8.8% growth ) , 320k ( 24%growth ) , Ebitda TL 17M ( 7.2% of NR ) , 24M ( 9.3% of NR ) , 36M ( 11.2% of NR ) , PBT TL ( loss 3.3 ) M, 10.9M, 19.5M.
On top of a major saving on financing cost through negotiations with banks, decreased bank loans by 33% at the end of first year, targeting further decrease for the current year.
Initiated and masterminded a financing deal with IFC -International Finance Corporation-, achieved a long term loan for a maturity of 8 years and value of TL 25M, which also leveraged the company have a strong negotiation power towards other banks.
Implemented Activity Based Costing and confirmed the support of shareholders through tangible results, enabled monitoring the strengths and weaknesses of business.
Conceptualized and launched Catering business, accounting for 30% volume growth in one year.
Led and implemented direct sales to Local Retail Chains/Key Accounts resulting in better cost allocation and customer management.
Initiated SAP project , which will go live on 1.1.2012 Outsourced HR process audits to map job levels, implement KPI and variable pay system targeting a career plan for all white collar employees.
Initiated the brand positioning survey via outsourced brand audit to identify gaps to improve existing products and discover new categories under Tamek brand.
Reorganized the Tamek Holding organization, targeting a central management of subsidiaries. Managing pricing, cash flow, profitability of Infima Holding N.V, which is the foreign affiliate of Holding, supplying concentrate for Pepsi Cola bottling operation in Northern Cyprus.
Financial Development Manager, Türk Tuborg Jan 2009 - Apr 2010 Reporting to CFO. Turnover TL 400M. Served as the project director for the multi-year turnaround and profit improvement project at Turk Tuborg - regional beer and beverage company owned by CBC ( Coca-Cola Israel ) - which resulted in profit within the first year with the execution of additional profit improvement action plan within the next three years in progress on target.
Responsibilities included managing the project phases of business analysis and modelling, business requirements definition, data requirements definition, blueprint development, system integration, software deployment, financial and operational validation, business user validation, value ID, value capture, ensuring buy-in and effective change management working actively with the executive management throughout the project. Developed a business modeling tool for Time-Driven Activity-Based Costing with profitability reporting and analysis by any business dimension such as sales organization, trade channel, segment, dealer, customer, outlet, SKU, product category, brand, package, etc. Also deployed the Activity-Based Budgeting tool for what-if and scenario analysis that help setting volume, discount, and margin targets and monitoring them for sales region, segment, and SKU. Managing the Credit Control Department of the company for the domestic market covering direct sales and sales to dealers. Focusing on the opportunity of financial tools provided by banks, increased the risk coverage while contributing the increase in sales. Worked on Direct Debit System for the dealers.
Responsible for the Sales Operations Department, managed a team of 17 people. Directing the project for changing the business operations system of the company at dealers' side and direct sales of Türk Tuborg.
Regata Dış Tic.Ltd.Şti and Kafkar Madencilik San. ve Tic.Ltd.Şti 2005 - 2009 Left Unilever to manage ongoing family business and established a foreign trade company in order to explode my professional experiences acquired in Central Asia. Founded own business in the field of import/export with one partner. Took care of customs and financial liabilities. Achieved US$ 3.0M turnover in 2005 and 2006. Represented JohnsonDiversey ( JD ) , Unilever Foodsolutions ( UBF ) in Uzbekistan and achieved US$ 0 ,5M turnover. Created out of home team for JD and UBF of 3 people in the country and gave the basic training. Achieved to sign contracts with all international hotels and two beer factories. Sold the company to local partner. Provided consultancy to local companies in Uzbekistan in management reporting systems and distribution channels. Inherited the family business in mining sector. After taking over the management, analyzed company profile, mainly the cost structure, profitability and outsourced services. Initially set three years investment plan. In two years time, company managed to fulfill its obligations to legal authorities and turned out to be a legal entity rather than a low profiled family business. The company achieved US$ 1 ,1M turnover and assets of US$ 0 ,6M with 2008 prices.
Country Manager, Unilever Central Asia for Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan and Tajikistan 2002-2005 Reporting to Managing Director of UniCA, Board Member of Unilever Turkey. Promoted to a challenging position to lead all sales, marketing and financial activities of the company in the above mentioned emerging markets with US$ 5 ,2M. turnover. As a board member of UniCA, with profit and loss responsibility, observed the growth opportunities and implemented new strategies in the assigned countries. Implemented new pricing and profitability system, by focusing on landed cost structure of the customers and market conditions. Prevented flow from neighboring countries via border trade. Created royalty to company brands, by abolishing fluctuating prices and implementing effective short and long term trade promotions. Increased the level of guarantee letter submitted to the company by the distributors from US$ 1.2M to US$ 3.0M. Hands on control on collections in an environment where did not exist a structured banking system. Decreased working capital of both UnICA and customers by %30 through closed follow-up of stocks, collections, credit lines, risk and guarantee letter in co-operation with finance and supply chain department. Contact with local private and legal authorities. Evaluated business opportunities for investment and acquisition plans of the company to increase awareness in local level. Recruited new sales representatives and merchandisers, provided the necessary training and performance indiCAtors and built a new sales team in Unilever standards. Managed a team of 60 persons in the end of the first year. In 2003 , increased the turnover by 103%, from US$ 5.2M to US$ 10.5M, as well as the double gross profit, mainly by increasing the geographiCAl coverage and switching to pre-sales and direct delivery from spot sales. Directed below/above the line marketing activities in co-operation with marketing department. Led negotiations with marketing agencies regarding media and promotional materials buying for a budget of US$ 0.7M. As consumer promotion, organized public concert for 15 ,000 people, for three years. Being the first such private organization, rewarded as number one brand in the country.
Brand Manager Personal Care Products, Unilever Central Asia 2001 - 2002 Reporting to Marketing Director, UniCA. Moved to a different functional role, in order to achieve in depth business touch for my future career path. Responsible for brand development and support for Personal Care Products category in the territory of Caucasia and Central Asia covering eight CIS countries. Organized launch program for Sunsilk shampoo. Over achieved the sales targets by 12% in the first year of launch. Implemented media plans, managed promotional activities, events and sponsorships with a total budget of US$ 0.65M.
Export Manager, Unilever Central Asia 1999 -2001 Reporting to Managing Director of UniCA, Board Member of Unilever Turkey. Turnover US$ 13M. Responsible for sales to neighboring countries like Iran, Iraq and Syria with no marketing activity. Held frequent visits to the territory. Launched new categories to the market such as personal care and home care. Increased the turnover by 51%, from US$ 8 ,8M to US$ 13.3M, with 28%gross margin. Reduced bad debt from US$1.1M to US$0.3M. Hands on control on collections, handed over business with zero credit.
Management Accountant, Unilever Central Asia 1996 - 1999 Reporting to Commercial Director, UniCA. Turnover US$ 130M. Promoted to a managerial position in a newly established growing business. Responsible for budgeting and reporting of trading results, fixed costs and marketing expenditures on monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. Consolidated data for 16 categories in eight operating countries. Monitored working capital of business. Designed and implemented unique budget and control system for the business to provide timely, consolidated information to management. Highlighted the deviations and proposed prompt necessary actions. Other than the tailor made program designed for the business, led adaptation to main SAP system of the company in three months. Took role in investment and acquisition proposals of the business . Direct contact with top customers ( 65% of total turnover ) on monetary issues. Address to internal and external auditors.
Cost Accountant BSS, Unilever 1993 - 1995 Reporting to Management Accountant BSS and Fixed Costs. Responsible for budgeting and reporting of Beverage and Savory Snacks category ( Lipton ) in Home Trade Business on monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. Responsible for budgeting, consolidation and reporting of fixed costs for Unilever Turkey.
Trainee in Financial Accounting and Treasury Department, Unilever 1992 - 1993 Assisted daily finance operations.

p.span: Trainee in Financial Accounting and Treasury Department, Unilever 1992 - 1993

SegExperience.JobDescription: General Manager, Kayeks A.Ş Dec 2015 - Apr 2016 Reporting to Chairman, Turnover TL 400M Kayeks is a partnership of public organization TKK %55 and private sector %45 established to dominate dried apricot production and export. Prior to partnership establishment, besides managing relations with TKK, led the full business plan including co-producers agreements, organizational structure, shareholder agreement etc. The company has been wound-up due to politiCAl reasons.

Freelance Management Consultant, Finance Oct 2012 - Dec 2015 Specialties Budgeting and Forecasting, Pricing, Cost Accounting, Working Capital Management, Profit Management, Restructuring, Merges and Acquisitions, Independent Board Member

General Coordinator, AVA Holding A.Ş Jan 2012 - Oct 2012 Turnover US$ 35M Responsible for the whole operations of the company dealing with mainly the supply chain management and logistics services of which the focus area is airlines catering, ship supply, remote site, peacekeeping forces etc. Led the sales process of one of the group companies.

Created and implemented Field Sales Automation System while reorganizing sales structure. The new system enabled to manage sales to and from dealers and direct customers. Resulted in a saving of 15% in discounts from 31% to 26% worth TL 6.0M in one year. Through monitoring and optimizing the dealers' stocks, lowered stock outs and increased sales volume by 6%, NR increased by 24%. Major achievements through years 2009 - 2011 respectively are, NR TL 237k, 258k 8.8% growth , 320k 24%growth , Ebitda TL 17M 7.2% of NR , 24M 9.3% of NR , 36M 11.2% of NR , PBT TL loss 3.3 M, 10.9M, 19.5M.
On top of a major saving on financing cost through negotiations with banks, decreased bank loans by 33% at the end of first year, targeting further decrease for the current year.
Initiated and masterminded a financing deal with IFC -International Finance Corporation-, achieved a long term loan for a maturity of 8 years and value of TL 25M, which also leveraged the company have a strong negotiation power towards other banks.
Implemented Activity Based Costing and confirmed the support of shareholders through tangible results, enabled monitoring the strengths and weaknesses of business.
Conceptualized and launched Catering business, accounting for 30% volume growth in one year.
Led and implemented direct sales to Local Retail Chains/Key Accounts resulting in better cost allocation and customer management.
Initiated SAP project , which will go live on 1.1.2012 Outsourced HR process audits to map job levels, implement KPI and variable pay system targeting a career plan for all white collar employees.
Initiated the brand positioning survey via outsourced brand audit to identify gaps to improve existing products and discover new categories under Tamek brand.
Reorganized the Tamek Holding organization, targeting a central management of subsidiaries. Managing pricing, cash flow, profitability of Infima Holding N.V, which is the foreign affiliate of Holding, supplying concentrate for Pepsi Cola bottling operation in Northern Cyprus.

CFO, Tamek Holding Turkey and Northern Cyprus, Director of Infima Holding N.V Apr 2010 -Oct 2011 Reporting to CEO. Turnover TL 400M. Responsible for Financial Accounting, Management Accounting, Sales Accounting, Finance, IT and HR
Serving as an Acting General Manager, implemented an exhaustive revamping of the sales and finance processes of the company to turnaround an 8 year consecutive loss making business into a sustainably profitable one within 1.5 years. Managed a team of 68 - 6 managers and 62 staff.
Led the organizational restructuring of the company including Finance, Sales, Marketing and HR departments.

Financial Development Manager, Türk Tuborg Jan 2009 - Apr 2010 Reporting to CFO. Turnover TL 400M. Served as the project director for the multi-year turnaround and profit improvement project at Turk Tuborg - regional beer and beverage company owned by CBC Coca-Cola Israel - which resulted in profit within the first year with the execution of additional profit improvement action plan within the next three years in progress on target.
Responsibilities included managing the project phases of business analysis and modelling, business requirements definition, data requirements definition, blueprint development, system integration, software deployment, financial and operational validation, business user validation, value ID, value capture, ensuring buy-in and effective change management working actively with the executive management throughout the project. Developed a business modeling tool for Time-Driven Activity-Based Costing with profitability reporting and analysis by any business dimension such as sales organization, trade channel, segment, dealer, customer, outlet, SKU, product category, brand, package, etc. Also deployed the Activity-Based Budgeting tool for what-if and scenario analysis that help setting volume, discount, and margin targets and monitoring them for sales region, segment, and SKU. Managing the Credit Control Department of the company for the domestic market covering direct sales and sales to dealers. Focusing on the opportunity of financial tools provided by banks, increased the risk coverage while contributing the increase in sales. Worked on Direct Debit System for the dealers.
Responsible for the Sales Operations Department, managed a team of 17 people. Directing the project for changing the business operations system of the company at dealers' side and direct sales of Türk Tuborg.

Regata Dış Tic.Ltd.Şti and Kafkar Madencilik San. ve Tic.Ltd.Şti 2005 - 2009 Left Unilever to manage ongoing family business and established a foreign trade company in order to explode my professional experiences acquired in Central Asia. Founded own business in the field of import/export with one partner. Took care of customs and financial liabilities. Achieved US$ 3.0M turnover in 2005 and 2006. Represented JohnsonDiversey JD , Unilever Foodsolutions UBF in Uzbekistan and achieved US$ 0 ,5M turnover. Created out of home team for JD and UBF of 3 people in the country and gave the basic training. Achieved to sign contracts with all international hotels and two beer factories. Sold the company to local partner. Provided consultancy to local companies in Uzbekistan in management reporting systems and distribution channels. Inherited the family business in mining sector. After taking over the management, analyzed company profile, mainly the cost structure, profitability and outsourced services. Initially set three years investment plan. In two years time, company managed to fulfill its obligations to legal authorities and turned out to be a legal entity rather than a low profiled family business. The company achieved US$ 1 ,1M turnover and assets of US$ 0 ,6M with 2008 prices.

Country Manager, Unilever Central Asia for Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan and Tajikistan 2002-2005 Reporting to Managing Director of UniCA, Board Member of Unilever Turkey. Promoted to a challenging position to lead all sales, marketing and financial activities of the company in the above mentioned emerging markets with US$ 5 ,2M. turnover. As a board member of UniCA, with profit and loss responsibility, observed the growth opportunities and implemented new strategies in the assigned countries. Implemented new pricing and profitability system, by focusing on landed cost structure of the customers and market conditions. Prevented flow from neighboring countries via border trade. Created royalty to company brands, by abolishing fluctuating prices and implementing effective short and long term trade promotions. Increased the level of guarantee letter submitted to the company by the distributors from US$ 1.2M to US$ 3.0M. Hands on control on collections in an environment where did not exist a structured banking system. Decreased working capital of both UnICA and customers by %30 through closed follow-up of stocks, collections, credit lines, risk and guarantee letter in co-operation with finance and supply chain department. Contact with local private and legal authorities. Evaluated business opportunities for investment and acquisition plans of the company to increase awareness in local level. Recruited new sales representatives and merchandisers, provided the necessary training and performance indiCAtors and built a new sales team in Unilever standards. Managed a team of 60 persons in the end of the first year. In 2003 , increased the turnover by 103%, from US$ 5.2M to US$ 10.5M, as well as the double gross profit, mainly by increasing the geographiCAl coverage and switching to pre-sales and direct delivery from spot sales. Directed below/above the line marketing activities in co-operation with marketing department. Led negotiations with marketing agencies regarding media and promotional materials buying for a budget of US$ 0.7M. As consumer promotion, organized public concert for 15 ,000 people, for three years. Being the first such private organization, rewarded as number one brand in the country.

Brand Manager Personal Care Products, Unilever Central Asia 2001 - 2002 Reporting to Marketing Director, UniCA. Moved to a different functional role, in order to achieve in depth business touch for my future career path. Responsible for brand development and support for Personal Care Products category in the territory of Caucasia and Central Asia covering eight CIS countries. Organized launch program for Sunsilk shampoo. Over achieved the sales targets by 12% in the first year of launch. Implemented media plans, managed promotional activities, events and sponsorships with a total budget of US$ 0.65M.

Export Manager, Unilever Central Asia 1999 -2001 Reporting to Managing Director of UniCA, Board Member of Unilever Turkey. Turnover US$ 13M. Responsible for sales to neighboring countries like Iran, Iraq and Syria with no marketing activity. Held frequent visits to the territory. Launched new categories to the market such as personal care and home care. Increased the turnover by 51%, from US$ 8 ,8M to US$ 13.3M, with 28%gross margin. Reduced bad debt from US$1.1M to US$0.3M. Hands on control on collections, handed over business with zero credit.

Management Accountant, Unilever Central Asia 1996 - 1999 Reporting to Commercial Director, UniCA. Turnover US$ 130M. Promoted to a managerial position in a newly established growing business. Responsible for budgeting and reporting of trading results, fixed costs and marketing expenditures on monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. Consolidated data for 16 categories in eight operating countries. Monitored working capital of business. Designed and implemented unique budget and control system for the business to provide timely, consolidated information to management. Highlighted the deviations and proposed prompt necessary actions. Other than the tailor made program designed for the business, led adaptation to main SAP system of the company in three months. Took role in investment and acquisition proposals of the business . Direct contact with top customers 65% of total turnover on monetary issues. Address to internal and external auditors.

Cost Accountant BSS, Unilever 1993 - 1995 Reporting to Management Accountant BSS and Fixed Costs. Responsible for budgeting and reporting of Beverage and Savory Snacks category Lipton in Home Trade Business on monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. Responsible for budgeting, consolidation and reporting of fixed costs for Unilever Turkey.

EXPERIENCE
CONSTANTIA FLEXIBLES ASAŞ ANKARA 02.2015 - Asas is producing flexible packaging materials for food industry. The site has 330 coworkers in 44.000 sqm areas. Turn over 75 M by 350 M m2 printed material :
There are 7 rotogravure printing lines, 3 lamination machines, 1 extrusion coating, ink production dept. and prepress dept.
Deputy General Manager, Head of Production Reporting to General Manager Responsible to drive all strategic and operational initiatives at the plant in order to deliver the products on time, at the right cost and at the best quality for maximizing customer satisfaction. Be accountable for all operation activities in the plant including production planning, printing, lamination, ink mixing, slitting, cylinder production, repro, maintenance, Investments, Quality. Direct Reports :
250 people Recommend and develop production technologies according to market requirements, including feasibility studies for machine investments. Responsible to all investments, new machinery and in production lines with building. Oversee, co-ordinate, plan and execute operational activities within budget Lead and drive improvement in Operational KPIs-order fulfillment, waste reduction, incr. productivity Optimize technical equipment, capacities, utilization, quality, Production/Planning, order processing, material planning. Manage production shifts ensuring optimum utilization of manpower resources Present the plant's possibilities to the sales department and other plants/regions ( increase turnover, get closer to customers and respond to customer demand Ensure transparency of Operational data, KPIs and analysis Ensure efficient collaboration and co-ordination between the various production departments and procurement, supply chain, quality management, maintenance Implementing standards of cleanliness and hygiene in the production units and implement HSE standards and initiatives to ensure safe working environment Manage and optimize team's performance through ongoing guidance, support, motivation and performance management Ensure all entities and employees within the Production organization conduct business in line with applicable laws and regulations, as well as with global and local policies and procedures and the companies code of conduct. Team Member of several project to increase efficiency and quality of suppliers, esp PET. Superfilm. Introducing and Implementing Health and Safety program in order to prevent injuries and fires. Coordination and implementing Operational Excellence program based on Lean Six Sigma 5 Projects implemented Customer Service department, Procurement and Supply Chain. Several projects in Production depts. Such as waste reduction, Set up time reduction, Quality level increase, Process stability, Reduction defect cost rate etc. Implementing Cultural Change Program throughout the company. Responsibilities for business results :
Plant financial results Comply with quality management systems ( ISO, OHSAS etc. ) Operational Excellence KPIs - OTIF, OEE, Waste rate, LTI frequency rate, Labor productivity, Defect cost rate, Complaint rate etc. Reduction in WIP and controlled stock
AMCOR FLEXIBLES ISTANBUL 05/2003 - 02/2015 AF Istanbul is producing flexible packaging materials for food industry. The site has 400 coworkers in 200.000 sqmtr open and 40.000sqmtr closed areas. turnover 70 M by 300 M m2 printed material :
There are 8 plastic film extrusion machines ( capacity 30 tons/day ) 7 rotogravure printing lines, 5 lamination machines, Ink production dept. and Prepress dept. Total closed storing area 24.000sqm.
OHSE and Technical Manager January 2008 - February 2015 Reporting to General Manager Istanbul Additional to the responsibilities of previous position Managing engineering dept. 32 people + 22 contractors. Continuous Improvement Projects :

Sponsoring, Leading or Coaching various Continuous Improvement Projects such as; 5S projects on all dept. As required, technical services and solving problems on packing machines of customers such as Nestle, Kraft, Cadbury in Turkey or abroad ( Russia, Italy, Germany, France, Norway, Ukraine, etc )
RIEGENS LIGTHING TURKEY 02/2001 - 05/2003 It was Denmark Based Company producing Lighting fixtures. Its Eskisehir Site was built in 2001 producing fixtures designed in Denmark. Resume.DetailResume:
MONAD İNSAN KAYNAKLARI DANIŞMANLIK VE EĞİTİM HİZMETLERİ LTD.ŞTİ. Türkiye İş Kurumu 13.04.2011 tarihli ve 178 numaralı izin belgesi ile faaliyet göstermektedir
DENİZ ERTUĞRUL BOZAN
YÜKSEK LİSANS : Boğaziçi Üniversitesi/Çevre Teknolojisi LİSANS : Boğaziçi Üniversitesi/Kimya Mühendisliği
Deniz Ertuğrul Bozan, 1996 yılında Boğaziçi Üniversitesi Kimya Mühendisliği bölümünden mezun olmuş, 1998 yılında Boğaziçi Üniversitesi'nde Çevre Teknolojisi alanında yüksek lisans eğitimini tamamlamıştır.
Profesyonel iş hayatına 1997 yılı Ağustos ayında Birleşik Oksijen Sanayi bünyesinde Çevre Süreçleri Satış Uzmanı olarak başlamış, müşteri portföyünün geliştirilerek satış ve pazarlama faaliyetlerinin yürütülmesi, uygulamalı süreçlerin periyodik olarak kontrolünün yapılması görevlerini üstlenmiştir. Kariyer hedefleri doğrultusunda farklı iş fırsatlarını değerlendirmek üzere 1999 yılı Mayıs ayında görevinden ayrılmıştır.
2000 yılı Nisan - Aralık ayları arasında Akzo Nobel Kemipol bünyesinde Sağlık, Güvenlik, Çevre ve Kalite ve Güvence Uzmanı olarak görev almış, atık yönetimi, hava emisyonları ve tesisin atık su süreçlerinden sorumlu olmuştur. Aynı zamanda iş sağlığı ve güvenliği ve ISO 14001 uygulama süreçlerini yürütmüştür. Attaş Alarko - Hillside bünyesinde oluşan fırsatı değerlendirmek üzere görevinden ayrılmıştır.
Aralık 2000 - Ağustos 2004 tarihleri arasında Attaş Alarko - Hillside bünyesinde Marka Müdürü olarak görev almış, pazarlama bütçe planlama çalışmalarının yapılması ve yönetilmesi, pazarlama planının oluşturulması ve uygulanması, promosyon - kampanya çalışmaları ile satı ve pazarlama stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi, fiyatlandırma stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi ve iş analizlerinin yapılması, pazar ve rakip faaliyet analizlerinin yapılması, reklam ve PR ajansları gibi üçüncü partiler ile ilişkilerin yürütülmesi, hizmet kalite programının geliştirilmesi, yeni projeler için fizibilite çalışmalarının yapılması ve sponsorluk faaliyetlerinin koordine edilmesi görevleri dahilinde olmuştur.
Eylül 2004 - Haziran 2007 tarihleri arasında Kenda Film Dağıtım bünyesinde Pazarlama Müdürü olarak görev almış, pazarlama stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi ve aktivite planının hazırlanması, bütçe planlama çalışmalarının yapılması, promosyon çalışmalarının koordine edilmesi, PR stratejilerinin planlanması, sponsorluk ve ürün yerleştirme çalışmalarının yapılması görevlerini başarı ile yerine getirmiştir.
Aralık 2007 - Ocak 2009 tarihleri arasında Capitol - Spectrum Cinemas bünyesinde Sinema Müdürü olarak görev almış, alışveriş merkezi genel müdürüne raporladığı bu görevinden yaklaşık 50 kişilik bir ekip yönetmiştir. Operasyonun planlanması ve yönetilmesi, bütçe yönetiminin yapılması, pazarlama faaliyetlerinin planlanması ve uygulanması, satış ve pazarlama stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi ve bu doğrultuda promosyon çalışmalarının yapılması, sponsorluk çalışmalarının yapılması sorumlulukları dahilinde olmuştur.
Nisan 2011 - Mayıs 2013 tarihleri arasında Emay Taahhüt İnşaat bünyesinde Pazarlama Koordinatörü olarak görev almış, Kentplus ve Brandium Ataşehir markaları için pazarlama strateji ve planlarının geliştirilmesi, etkinlik ve pazarlama faaliyetlerinin uygulanması, üçüncü partiler ile ilişkilerin yönetilmesi, pazar analizleri ve rakip faaliyet analizleri doğrultusunda fiyatlandırma stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi, sosyal medya hesaplarının yönetilmesi, iş geliştirme süreçlerinin yürütülmesi görevlerini üstlenmiştir.
Deniz Ertuğrul Bozan, aktif bir iş arayışı içerisinde olup katma değer sağlayabileceği gelişime açık ve kurumsal yapılarda oluşabilecek cazip iş fırsatlarını değerlendirmek istemektedir.

pazarlama faaliyetlerinin planlanması ve uygulanması, satış ve pazarlama stratejilerinin geliştirilmesi ve bu doğrultuda
sponsorluk çalışmalarının yapılması sorumlulukları dahilinde olmuştur.
Nisan 2011 - Mayıs 2013 tarihleri arasında Emay Taahhüt İnşaat bünyesinde
Pazarlama Koordinatörü olarak görev almış, Kentplus ve Brandium
Ataşehir markaları için pazarlama strateji ve planlarının geliştirilmesi, etkinlik ve pazarlama faaliyetlerinin uygulanması, üçüncü partiler ile iliş
pazar analizleri ve rakip faaliyet analizleri doğrultusunda
iş geliştirme süreçlerinin yürütülmesi görevlerini üstlenmiştir.
Deniz Ertuğrul Bozan, aktif bir iş arayışı içerisinde olup katma değer sağlayabileceği gelişime açık ve kurumsal yapılarda oluşabilecek cazip iş fırsatlarını değerlendirmek istemektedir.
ears of sales, marketing, brand management, business development, project management and management experience in industrial products, construction, entertainment and service businesses.
